title: Are computers (robots & machines) smarter than humans? - Quora

response.answer_text: Please give a specific definition of “smart”. In terms of pure computation, computers surpassed human almost right after the birth. In terms of object recognition, recent deep learning breakthrough have enabled AI to surpass human in quite a few field. In terms of creativity, humans are much better. Although there are some publications of AI making art, such as painting, it is not really creativity. The paint is just a specific combination of the trained features. However, human can organize and create something really new. For some tasks, AI is just much faster than human, such as sorting a sequence. That could be called smarter if you would like.

If you consider smart as having a quick thinking, problem solving conscience, then of course not. Computers can only do what humans program them to do. But… deep learning has become a thing… and it is “giving” computers algorithms that allow it to essentially figure out a problem without being told the answer. This could be the beginning of the “Yes” answer to your question. Maybe not in our lifetime though.
Robots are not smart at all. Robots are simply the name for machines which mimic the look or actions of humans, they don't mimic our intelligence. It is AI which will one day, mimic our intelligence.

Humans have abstraction (which I think is the domain of reference exclusively made possible through consciousness). Robots et al. do not yet have consciousness. This in part helps to explain why humans are able to synthesise robotic systems, but robotic systems have not yet synthesised humans. But then — what’s the difference between synthetic and non-synthetic? Machine and man? An arbitrary line: the same line that appears to separate chicken and egg.
No. They have no more intelligence than a TV has creativity. The computer just does what it is programmed to do. It is the programmer that is intelligent.
